snippet: An angry Gov. Terry McAuliffe was forced to retreat after losing a fight with the Republican-dominated General Assembly.
abstract: Virginia Gov Terry McAuliffe, who in June ordered his cabinet to devise plan to expand Medicaid unilaterally, announces that only 25,000 uninsured Virginians will be receiving coverage, far fewer than 400,000 he has said are eligible if state expands Medicaid under Affordable Care Act; move is sign of how McAuliffe has been forced to retreat after losing fight with Republican-dominated General Assembly.
lead_paragraph: An angry Gov. Terry McAuliffe was forced to retreat after losing a fight with the Republican-dominated General Assembly.

headline.main: After First Plan Is Blocked, Virginia Governor Reduces Medicaid Expansion Goals
headline.print_headline: After First Plan Is Blocked, Virginia Governor Reduces Medicaid Expansion Goals

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
